findings.message: Detected input from a HTTPServletRequest going into a SQL sink or statement. This could lead to SQL injection if variables in the SQL statement are not properly sanitized. Use parameterized SQL queries or properly sanitize user input instead.
findings.snippet: 1: â†’ import java.sql.*;import javax.servlet.http.*;public class UnsafeUserService{public String get(HttpServletRequest r)throws SQLException{String id=r.getParameter("id");String sql="SELECT * FROM users WHERE id=\u0027"+id+"\u0027";return DriverManager.getConnection("jdbc:mysql://localhost/db").createStatement().executeQuery(sql).toString();}}

remediation.approach: Use parameterized queries, avoid dynamic command construction, validate all inputs
remediation.validation: Test with injection payloads, use automated scanning tools, code review
remediation.risk: Can lead to complete system compromise, data breach, or service disruption
